metadata.title: CVE-2019-6446 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED **   An issue was discovered in NumPy 1.16.0 and earlier. Ituses the pickle Python module unsafely, which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted serialized object, as demonstrated bya numpy.load call. NOTE: third parties dispute this issue because it is  abehavior that might have legitimate applications in (for example)  loadingserialized Python object arrays from trusted and authenticated  sources.

criterions.comment: python-numpy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
